KnowledgeBase.Title: ccompareLT
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: ccompare ccompareEQ ccompareNE ccompareGE ccompareGT ccompareLE

Function.Description: The ccompareLT is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Boolean values. It returns true if the first object is lesser than the second object and false if otherwise.

Brief.Overview: The ccompareLT is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Character values. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: Use the ccompareLT function when you wish to compare two Characters and determine if {char1} is lesser than {char2} and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). These functions only operate on Boolean operands. For a more general, but slower, comparison, use the compareEQ, compareNE, compareGT, compareGE, compareLT, and compareLE which performs type checking and type conversions.

Argument.Name: char1
Argument.Note: The first Character to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the first Character is lesser than the second Character and false if the first Character is greater or equal in value than the second Character.
